faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: This course introduces systematic methods for software testing.
description.et: Tutvutakse süstemaatiliselt tähtsamate tarkvara testimise metoodikatega

objectives.en: The course addresses the essential concepts of software quality control and testing and introduces various testing strategies and types of testing. It will also give an overview of different software defects, software defect management, and organizational aspects of software testing.
objectives.et: Aines käsitletakse tarkvara kvaliteedikontrolli ja testimise põhimõisteid, erinevaid testimisstrateegiaid ning testide tüüpe. Ülevaade antakse samuti erinevatest tarkvaras esinevatest vigadest, vigade haldamisest ja testimisorganisatsiooni rollist tarkvaraprojekti vältel.

learning_outcomes.en: On successful completion of this course, students will be able to demonstrate knowledge of:
- The role of testing in the software development process
learning_outcomes.et: 1) teab testimise rolli osatähtsust tarkvaraarenduse protsessis;
2) on võimeline läbi viima testimise planeerimist ja dokumenteerimist;
4) oskab läbi viia staatilist testimist ja vigade hinnangut;

description.et: Homeworks associated to this course are listed in the course web site: https://courses.cs.ut.ee/2025/SWT2024/spring
The final exam will aim at assessing the level of knowledge of the theoretical aspects of the course.

There will be weekly quizzes about the contents presented during lectures. The purpose of the quizzes is to motivate students to cover the lecture materials in preparation for the homework assignments. The quizzes will be delivered through Moodle.

grade_preconditions.en:
General rule:
- Active participation in labs and associated assignments/reports (homework) - work individually or in pairs (60% of course grade)
- Quizzes - individual (10% of course grade)
- Participation in final exam - individual (30% of course grade)

The following marks must be achieved to be admitted to the final exam:
- Student must get at least 33% of the maximum possible marks for all labs

The following rules must be fulfilled to not fail the course:
- Student must be admitted to final exam
- In final exam, at least 33% of the maximum possible marks must be achieved
- In total (labs and final exam together), at least 50% of the maximum possible marks must be achieved

For further details, see course wiki page

grade_evaluation.en:
On successful completion of this course, students will be able to demonstrate knowledge of:
- The role of testing in the software development process
- Test planning and documentation
- Different types of testing techniques
- Static testing and defect estimation
- Automated testing

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

topic.en: Schedule (tentative - adjustments will be announced on the course wiki)
topic.et: Schedule (tentative - adjustments will be announced on the course wiki)

description.en:
- Week 24: Introduction to Software Testing
- Week 25: Basic Black-Box and White-Box Testing Techniques - Part 1
- Week 26: Basic Black-Box and White-Box Testing Techniques - Part 2
- Week 27: Black-Box Testing (advanced): Combinatorial Testing
- Week 28: White-Box Testing (advanced): Instruction and Control-Flow Coverage
- Week 29: Black-Box Testing (advanced): State-Transition Testing, Random Testing, GUI Testing
- Week 30: Test Lifecycle, Test Levels, Test Tools
- Week 31: Black-Box Testing (advanced): Metamorphic Testing / Security Testing / Usability Testing / A/B Testing
- Week 32: Security Testing (web and mobile apps)
- Week 33: Data-Flow Testing / Mutation Testing
- Week 34: White-Box Testing (advanced): Symbolic Execution, Static Code Analysis, Document Inspections, Code Review
- Week 35: no lecture due to holiday 
- Week 36: Quality Estimation / Test Documentation, Organisation and Process Improvement (Test Maturity Model)
- Week 37: Black-Box Testing (advanced): Exploratory Testing / Behaviour Testing / Exam Preparation
- Weeks 38-39: Exams

topic.en: Schedule (tentative - adjustments will be announced on the course wiki)
topic.et: Schedule (tentative - adjustments will be announced on the course wiki)

description.en:
- Week 26: Debugging
- Week 27: Basic Black-Box-Testing - Equivalence Class Partitioning
- Week 28: Combinatorial Testing
- Week 29: Basic White-Box Testing - Code Coverage Criteria
- Week 30: Unit Test Generation using EvoSuite
- Week 31: Automated Web-Application Testing (Selenium)
- Week 32: Metamorphic Testing
- Week 33: Security Testing
- Week 34: Mutation Testing
- Week 35: no labs due to holiday on May 1
- Week 36: Static Code Analysis (FindBugs)
- Week 37: Document Inspection and Defect Prediction
